Financial aid awarded by Columbia f

30% discount rate

25%

Columbia’s net tuition revenue over a fiscal year is

given by the grant aid it awards subtracted from its

gross tuition revenue.

The discount rate, representing the percentage of

gross tuition revenue that is accounted as instutional

grant aid, saw a net increase since 2007 but a net

decrease in the last 10 years.

20%

15%

15% increase from previous fiscal year

Columbia has seen multiple years during

which gross tuition revenue grew faster

than institutional grant aid awarded.

 

Since the percentage of students

receiving federal grant aid has remained

largely constant, this suggests either a

decrease in financial aid generosity or

a decreased demand for institutional

aid within the changing student body.

10%
